markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 2+"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Fanged](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1433)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Transmutation" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=157" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 106

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** etched onto a melee weapon

</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

When etched with this rune, a weapon's hilt or haft becomes engraved with grooves that match the imprints of a wolf's teeth. By putting a _fanged_ weapon in your mouth, you can transform into an animal.

**Activate** <actions string="Single Action" /> Interact ([magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157))    **Effect** You transform into a Small or Medium animal that wields the _fanged_ weapon in its jaws; the animal matches the animal you are most closely associated with (a [lizardfolk](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=15) would turn into a lizard, a [kitsune](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=38) into a fox, a [deer instinct](/Instincts.aspx?ID=1) [barbarian](/Classes.aspx?ID=2) into a deer, etc.) or a wolf if no specific animal is applicable. While in this form, you can attack with the _fanged_ weapon even though you don't have any hands. However, you can attack only with the _fanged_ weapon and you don't have hands or the ability to hold items. For effects dependent on how many hands you are using to hold the item, such as the [two-hand](/Traits.aspx?ID=198) trait, you are holding the weapon in two hands. You can Dismiss this effect, and it ends automatically if you drop the _fanged_ weapon (whether or not of your own volition).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 2"
pfs="Standard"
>
Fanged
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 106

**Price** 30 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 8"
pfs="Standard"
>
Fanged (Greater)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 106

**Price** 425 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

In animal form, you gain [low-light vision](/Rules.aspx?ID=416) and a +5-foot item bonus to your Speed.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 15"
pfs="Standard"
>
Fanged (Major)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Grand Bazaar](/Sources.aspx?ID=100) pg. 106

**Price** 6,000 gp

<row gap="medium">

</row>

</column>

---

In animal form, you gain low-light vision, imprecise scent to a range of 30 feet, and a +10-foot item bonus to your Speed.
name: Fanged (Greater)
